case_vignette: A 57-year-old man presents to the emergency department after an episode of syncope. He states that he was at home when he suddenly felt weak and experienced back pain that has been persistent. He states that he vomited forcefully several times after the episode. The patient has a past medical history of diabetes, hypertension, dyslipidemia, and depression. He smokes 1.5 packs of cigarettes per day and drinks 10 alcoholic beverages each night. His temperature is 97.5°F (36.4°C), blood pressure is 107/48 mmHg, pulse is 130/min, respirations are 19/min, and oxygen saturation is 99% on room air. A chest radiograph is within normal limits. Physical exam is notable for abdominal tenderness and a man resting in an antalgic position. Urinalysis is currently pending but reveals a concentrated urine sample.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I suddenly felt weak, had persistent back pain, and vomited several times forcefully.
Do you have a history of high blood pressure or heart disease?
Yes, I have a history of high blood pressure, but I have not mentioned any heart disease.
Do you take any medications for your high blood pressure? If so, what are they?
My vignette does not provide specifics about medications, so I can't say if I take any or what they might be.
Do you have a family history of heart disease or high blood pressure? If so, who in your family has it?
My family history has not been mentioned, so I don't know if there is any heart disease or high blood pressure in my family.
I understand. Lastly, may I ask for your age and sex?
I am a 57-year-old man.
**Final Diagnosis:** Possible Acute Aortic Dissection
